The Perkins District Leadership Team (DLT) reviewed preliminary Ohio Department of Education report card data expected to be released in September. With the data, the team began formalizing benchmarks to improve students‚Äô academic achievement measured by state testing.

The DLT also discussed action steps and initiatives teachers and staff will put in place to improve student performances.

The DLT, which includes district administrators, teachers, and parents, as well as business and community leaders, meets quarterly.

Over the past year, the team has launched a comprehensive strategic planning process and has identified three key focus areas ‚Äì academics, climate and culture, and facilities.

The team will meet next on Oct. 17.

Fate has ordered some emergency repairs in the north parking lot at Perkins High School. On Friday, Aug. 2, a waterline under the parking lot ruptured, filling the lot with water.
Perkins Local Schools maintenance crews were quick to turn off the water, but major repairs were needed.
Contractors dug up and repaired the waterline. The school district also needed to repair and repave a portion of the lot, which is being finished today.
The water line repair cost $2,475 and repaving the lot is not to exceed $42,000.
The waterline dates back 55 years when the school district built the 600-Wing of Perkins High School
The good news? The line ruptured in the summer when there are fewer people using the lot and the spilled water did not freeze.
